JobFullDesc: About the RoleAre you interested in driving business and product strategy? What about using data to answer difficult questions and come up with interesting insights? If so, then this is the job for you. Product analysts partner with product managers, data scientists, engineers, design, and other key partners and use data to deeply understand our customers and the impact that our products have on them. As a Product Analyst on this team, you will shape the experience of customers interacting with Uber products. For this role you should have excellent analytical skills, excellent time-management and organizational habits, and the ability to clearly communicate and present information for stakeholders at all levels of the business. You possess a passion for improving Customer experience by identifying and resolving friction and recommending data driven changes to make the experience world class. You'll play a big part in finding product opportunity as we develop onboarding, engagement and retention strategies. You will also learn and apply advanced analytics skills like experimental design, machine learning, statistical modeling, and more. What You'll DoDefine key metrics to evaluate the success of the business, team, and new featuresRefine ambiguous questions and generate new hypotheses about the product through a deep understanding of the data, our customers, and our businessAnalyze opportunities and problems to drive product prioritization and strategyCollaborate with data scientists and engineers to ensure and improve data availability, integrity, accuracy, and reliabilityConduct experiments to evaluate the impact of new product featuresBuild dashboards to track the progress of feature rollouts and the long-term success of productsDevelop analytical frameworks to support decision making Basic QualificationsMinimum 4 years of product analytics (or equivalent) experience.BA, BS, or MS degree in Economics, Business, Engineering, Operations Research, or other quantitative focus.Basic understanding of experimental design (such as A/B experiments) and statistical methods Preferred QualificationsWillingness to get into the details with messy data to identify product opportunities and uncover interesting product insightsStrong storytelling: distill interesting and hard-to-find insights into a compelling, concise data storyAbility to communicate effectively and manage relationships with stakeholders coming from both technical and non-technical backgroundsPassionate and attentive self-starters, great communicators, amazing follow-through - you have a great work ethic and love the responsibilities from being personally empoweredExperience working on user interaction data, conducting behavioral, funnel analysisProgramming languages such as R and/or PythonSQL fluency: ability to work with large data setsExperience in reporting-based software, such as Shiny or TableauAbility and experience in extracting insights from data, and summarizing learnings / takeawaysExperience with Excel and some dashboarding/data visualization (i.e. Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar)Strong communication and organization skills
